chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Thomas Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Apply 140 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Walmart, Walgreens or any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction - Lift of Stayed Condition Time 90 days County Jail for the current violations, commencing 10-27-2015.
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction received by Department of Corrections.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nathan Thomas Boyd in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   
Jury Status and Jury Trial Canceled.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant's mother presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
WITHHELD SENTENCE.
140 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Wal-Mart, Walgreens or any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defense request expungement.
Court Denies request for Expungement.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
